metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9808 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The FLIC decoder in GStreamer before 1.10.2 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write and crash) via a craftedseries of skip and count pairs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9808` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gstreamer0.10-gconf - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.2
gstreamer0.10-plugins-good - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.2
gstreamer0.10-pulseaudio - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.2
No subscription required

gstreamer1.0-plugins-good - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.3
gstreamer1.0-pulseaudio - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.3
libgstreamer-plugins-good1.0-0 - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-good0.10 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.2').
gst-plugins-good1.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.3').
